duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive and individualized clinical pharmacy services to adult outpatient medical oncology patients as part of multidisciplinary teams.
Educate patients and their families on treatment administration schedule and toxicity management.
Identify patient needs and proactively provide solutions.
Deliver in-services and educate pharmacy, medical, and nursing staff on evidence-based best practice and appropriate medication utilization.
Contribute to the development, maintenance, and management of medication-related guidelines.
Identify service-related issues requiring evaluation and facilitate research projects and quality improvement initiatives.
Serve as preceptor for and maintain active involvement in the PGY-2 Oncology residency program.
Provide precepting mentorship for PGY-1 pharmacy residents and pharmacy students.
Participate in Pharmacy and collaborative departmental subcommittees, including Pharmacy and Therapeutics Committee.
Involvement in external presentations, publications, and professional organizations.

education_certification.credential: PharmD degree from an accredited College of Pharmacy.
Current licensure in good standing in the State of Florida.
PGY-1 and PGY-2 Hematology/Oncology Residency or Board Certification in Oncology Pharmacy.
